TopicTitle: Kroyuz N1-L3 Stockalike Sovietic Lunar Lander!

Articles.Content:
Just something quick I whipped up.

A soviet style lunar lander!

Low part count (103) and tons of delta v. And when I say tonnes, I mean it.

[Download](https://www.dropbox.com/s/qz8xreaa5csome9/Kroyuz%20Soviet%20Style%20Lander.craft?dl=0)

You are the king! Awesome one! Although, I'd go with 1.25 Soyuz on that one, with two Mk1 pods attached radially at flat octo core as 2-seat crew capsule. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Inaccurate, doesn't explode every time and can actually get to its destination. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Jk, looks great and doesn't melt PCs - awesome job ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Really nice work, Yukon! You always impress me again.

> 
> Inaccurate, doesn't explode every time and can actually get to its destination. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Huh? The soyuz works perfect since 1967 and

> 
> Soyuz is widely considered the world's safest, most cost-effective human spaceflight system,[^\[3\]^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soyuz_%28spacecraft%29#cite_note-3) established by its unparalleled length of operational history.

I really canÃ‚Â´t see why it should explode.

he means the N1-rocket, which exploded everytime shortly after liftoff ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> he means the N1-rocket, which exploded everytime shortly after liftoff ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Sorry! When I read "Kroyuz" I thought he would build a mun lander on a soyuz replica. Sorry again!
Nice, I always like unusual mun lander designs!

I decided to make my own low-part count N-1/L3 complex, inspired by you beauty. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

200 parts and 800k funds later: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113744](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113744)

Looks marvelous, Yukon! It pays lots of detail on the launcher itself with the distinctive triangular boosters, yet looks imaginative as a lander, too! 

Great work! I wish I could build a Soyuz look-alike without having to put so much parts (I seriously made a 1101 part Soyuz once) let alone a Mun lander for the job! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
